message.content:
We first need to calculate each metric using the following formulas:

1. Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio = Total Revenue ÷ Average Accounts Receivable  
  • Average Accounts Receivable = (Beginning AR + Ending AR) ÷ 2.  
   • Here, beginning AR = 0 (since on 2023‑12‑31 the Accounts Receivable is 0) and ending AR = 1,604,015.21.  
   • Average AR = (0 + 1,604,015.21) ÷ 2 = 802,007.605  
  • Total Revenue (from income statement) = 5,755,241.17  
  • Thus, Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio = 5,755,241.17 ÷ 802,007.605 ≈ 7.18

2. Operating Cash Flow Ratio (and Operating Cash Flow to Current Liabilities Ratio) = Operating Cash Flow ÷ Total Current Liabilities  
  • Operating Cash Flow (from cash flow) = –7,724,112.71  
  • Total Current Liabilities (from balance sheet at period end) = 737,762.05  
  • Ratio = –7,724,112.71 ÷ 737,762.05 ≈ –10.47

3. Total Asset Turnover Ratio = Total Revenue ÷ Average Total Assets  
  • Average Total Assets = (Beginning Total Assets + Ending Total Assets) ÷ 2.  
   • Beginning Total Assets = 13,000,000.00  
   • Ending Total Assets = 12,385,382.42  
   • Average Total Assets = (13,000,000.00 + 12,385,382.42) ÷ 2 ≈ 12,692,691.21  
  • Ratio = 5,755,241.17 ÷ 12,692,691.21 ≈ 0.45

4. Debt to Equity Ratio = Total Liabilities ÷ Total Owner’s Equity  
  • Here total liabilities are the total current liabilities (as no non-current liabilities are provided): 737,762.05  
  • Total Owner’s Equity (from balance sheet end) = 11,647,620.37  
  • Ratio = 737,762.05 ÷ 11,647,620.37 ≈ 0.0633, which rounds to 0.06

Thus, the final answers rounded to two decimal places are:

{
  "solution": {
    "Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio": "7.18",
    "operating cash flow ratio": "-10.47",
    "operating cash flow to current liabilities ratio": "-10.47",
    "Total Asset Turnover Ratio": "0.45",
    "Debt to Equity Ratio": "0.06"
  }
}
